Back to Franz Schubert

Franz Schubert

Sonata in E-flat major, D 568

1817 · op. 122

[Wikipedia page 1] · [Wikipedia page 2] · [IMSLP]

Total duration: 29'

  • 1. Allegro moderato
  • 1. Allegro moderato (earlier version, D 567/1)
  • 2. Andante molto
  • 2. Andante molto (earlier version, D 567/2)
  • 3. Menuetto: Allegretto
  • 4. Allegro moderato
  • 4. Allegretto (earlier version, D 567/3)

There exists an earlier D-flat major version of three movements of the sonata (D 567).

Recommended editions

  • Neue Schubert-Ausgabe (Bärenreiter) · VII/2/1 · BA 5553 · Klaviersonaten I · ed. Walburga Litschauer [including D 567, and for this the first version of mov. 1 and earlier sketches of movs. 2–3]
  • Associated Board · Complete Pianoforte Sonatas / Volume I · ed. Howard Ferguson [including D 567]
  • Bärenreiter · BA 9642 · Klaviersonaten I / Die frühen Sonaten · ed. Walburga Litschauer [including D 567]
  • Henle · HN 146 · Klaviersonaten / Band I · ed. Paul Mies
  • Henle · HN 147 · Klaviersonaten / Band I · ed. Paul Mies
  • Henle · HN 150 · Klaviersonaten / Band III · ed. Paul Mies [D 567]
  • Henle · HN 151 · Klaviersonaten / Band III · ed. Paul Mies [D 567]
  • Henle · HN 1557 · ed. Dominik Rahmer
  • Wiener Urtext · UT 50220 · Sämtliche Klaviersonaten / Band 1 · ed. Martino Tirimo [including D 567]

1. Allegro moderato

Duration: 9' 30"

Difficulty: 3

1. Allegro moderato (earlier version, D 567/1)

Duration: 9'

Difficulty: 3

2. Andante molto

Duration: 5' 30"

Difficulty: 3

2. Andante molto (earlier version, D 567/2)

Duration: 5' 30"

Difficulty: 3

3. Menuetto: Allegretto

The trio is an alternative version of the trio to the scherzo in D-flat major (D 593 no. 2).

Duration: 4' 30"

Difficulty: 2.5

4. Allegro moderato

Duration: 9' 30"

Difficulty: 3.5

4. Allegretto (earlier version, D 567/3)

This movement is incomplete, although a completion is straightforward to make through adapting the later E-flat major version.

Duration: 7' 30"

Difficulty: 3.5
